meanings.definition: A cultural group within a larger culture, often having beliefs or interests at variance with those of the larger culture.
meanings.sent1: The subcult of skateboarders in our town is known for their unique style and tricks.
meanings.sent2: The subcult of artists in the city often gather to showcase their work at local galleries.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, there was a subcult of guests dressed as characters from a popular TV show.
meanings.sent4: The subcult of book lovers can be seen spending hours in the library, immersed in their favorite novels.
meanings.sent5: In the bustling city, the subcult of street performers adds a touch of creativity to the busy streets.

meanings.sent1: She wanted to subcult a community of like-minded individuals who shared her passion for gardening.
meanings.sent2: The students decided to subcult a club dedicated to promoting environmental awareness on campus.
meanings.sent3: He managed to subcult a group of friends who enjoyed exploring abandoned buildings for fun.
meanings.sent4: The chef aimed to subcult a team of culinary enthusiasts to experiment with new recipes.
meanings.sent5: The young entrepreneur sought to subcult a network of aspiring business owners for mutual support.
